intro: Veronica anagallis-aquatica proles aquatica, commonly known as the water speedwell, is a herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers and linear leaves. It thrives in moist or aquatic environments, often found in wet meadows, marshes, and along the edges of ponds. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its roots are fibrous and help stabilize soil in wetland areas. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is known for its adaptability to waterlogged conditions.
